# dotenvx

> dotenvx is an enhanced version of dotenv, offering cross-platform support, multiple environment handling, encryption, and more, to streamline environment variable management across various languages and frameworks.

dotenvx provides a consistent interface for managing environment variables, ensuring seamless integration across different development environments. Key features include:

- **Cross-Platform Compatibility:** Uniform behavior across all languages, frameworks, and platforms.
- **Multiple Environment Support:** Easily switch between different environment configurations.
- **Encryption:** Secure your `.env` files with built-in encryption capabilities.
- **Variable Expansion:** Reference other variables within your `.env` files.
- **Command Substitution:** Execute commands within your `.env` files.
- **Multi-Line Values:** Support for multi-line secrets, such as public keys.
- **Debugging Tools:** Built-in debugging features for both server and local environments.
- **Contextual Help:** Guidance and next steps when issues arise.
- **Additional Utilities:** Features like appending to `.gitignore`, generating `.env.example`, and more.

## Getting Started

- [Basics | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/quickstart)
  Manage secrets with dotenvx

## Guides

- [Guides | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/guides)
  Language, platform, and framework guides

## Documentation

- [.env | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/env-file)
  The .env file separates your secrets from code.

- [.env.keys (old format deprecated) | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/env-keys-file-deprecated)
  (DEPRECATED) The .env.keys file contains holds environment DOTENV_KEYs

- [.env.keys | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/env-keys-file)
  `.env.keys` holds your private decryption keys.

- [.env.vault (DEPRECATED) | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/env-vault-file)
  (DEPRECATED) The .env.vault file is an encrypted version of your .env file.

- [Advanced | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced)
  Advanced usage and commands for `dotenvx`

- [Astro | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/frameworks/astro)
  Use `dotenvx` with Astro.

- [Blog | dotenvx](https://dotenvx.com/blog)
  a better dotenv‚Äìfrom the creator of dotenv

- [Deprecated | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/deprecated)
  Deprecated `.env` file formats and technologies.

- [Documentation | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs)
  Documentation for `dotenvx`

- [DOTENV_KEY (deprecated) | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/dotenv-key)
  TheDOTENV_KEYhas been DEPRECATED since May 2024. Please seeupdated encryption instructions.

- [DOTENV_PRIVATE_KEY=key DOTENV_PRIVATE_KEY_PRODUCTION=key dotenvx run | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/run-dotenv-private-key-multiple)
  Decrypt your encrypted `.env` and `.env.production` files by setting `DOTENV_PRIVATE_KEY` and `DOTENV_PRIVATE_KEY_PRODUCTION` before dotenvx run.

- [DOTENV_PRIVATE_KEY=key dotenvx run | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/run-dotenv-private-key)
  Decrypt your encrypted `.env` by setting `DOTENV_PRIVATE_KEY` before dotenvx run.

- [DOTENV_PRIVATE_KEY_CI=key dotenvx run | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/run-dotenv-private-key-ci)
  Decrypt your encrypted `.env.ci` by setting `DOTENV_PRIVATE_KEY_CI` before dotenvx run.

- [DOTENV_PRIVATE_KEY_PRODUCTION=key dotenvx run | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/run-dotenv-private-key-production)
  Decrypt your encrypted `.env.production` by setting `DOTENV_PRIVATE_KEY_PRODUCTION` before dotenvx run.

- [dotenvx ext genexample -f | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/genexample-f)
  Pass multiple .env files to generate your .env.example file from the combination of their contents.

- [dotenvx ext genexample directory | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/genexample-directory)
  Generate a .env.example file inside the specified directory. Useful for monorepos.

- [dotenvx ext genexample | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/genexample)
  Generate a .env.example file from your current .env file contents.

- [dotenvx get --all --pretty-print | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/get-all-pretty-print)
  Make the output more readable - pretty print it.

- [dotenvx get --all | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/get-all)
  Return preset machine envs as well.

- [dotenvx get --format eval | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/get-eval)
  Return an eval-ready shell formatted response of all key/value pairs in a .env file.

- [dotenvx get --format shell | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/get-shell)
  Return a shell formatted response of all key/value pairs in a .env file.

- [dotenvx get KEY --env | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/get-key-env)
  Return a single environment variable's value from a --env string.

- [dotenvx get KEY --overload | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/get-key-overload)
  Return a single environment variable's value where each found value is overloaded.

- [dotenvx get KEY -f | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/get-key-f)
  Return a single environment variable's value from a specific .env file.

- [dotenvx get KEY | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/get-key)
  Return a single environment variable's value.

- [dotenvx get | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/get-json)
  Return a json response of all key/value pairs in a .env file.

- [dotenvx keypair --format shell | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/keypair-shell)
  Print a shell formatted reponse of public/private keys.

- [dotenvx keypair -f | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/keypair-f)
  Print public/private keys for chosen .env* files.

- [dotenvx keypair KEY | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/keypair-key)
  Print specific keypair for .env file.

- [dotenvx keypair | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/keypair)
  Print public/private keys for .env file.

- [dotenvx ls -ef | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/ls-ef)
  Glob .env filenames excluding a wildcard.

- [dotenvx ls -f | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/ls-f)
  Glob .env filenames matching a wildcard.

- [dotenvx ls directory | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/ls-directory)
  Print all .env files inside a specified path to a directory.

- [dotenvx ls | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/ls)
  Print all .env files in a tree structure.

- [dotenvx run - Command Substitution | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/run-command-substitution)
  Add the output of a command to one of your variables in your .env file.

- [dotenvx run - Shell Expansion | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/run-shell-expansion)
  Prevent your shell from expanding inline `$VARIABLES` before dotenvx has a chance to inject them. Use a subshell.

- [dotenvx run - Variable Expansion | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/run-variable-expansion)
  Reference and expand variables already on your machine for use in your .env file.

- [dotenvx run --debug | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/run-debug)
  Set log level to `debug`.

- [dotenvx run --env HELLO=String | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/run-env)
  Set environment variables as a simple KEY=value string pair.

- [dotenvx run --log-level | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/run-log-level)
  Set `--log-level` to whatever you wish.

- [dotenvx run --quiet | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/run-quiet)
  Use `--quiet` to suppress all output (except errors).

- [dotenvx run --verbose | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/run-verbose)
  Set log level to `verbose`.

- [dotenvx run -f | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/run-f)
  Compose multiple .env files for environment variables loading, as you need.

- [dotenvx set KEY "value with spaces" | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/set-key-value-with-spaces)
  Set a value containing spaces.

- [dotenvx set KEY -- "- + * √∑" | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/set-key-value-with-leading-dash)
  Set a value containing a leading dash.

- [dotenvx set KEY value --encrypt | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/set-key-value-encrypt)
  Set an encrypted key/value.

- [dotenvx set KEY value --plain | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/set-key-value-plain)
  Set a plain key/value.

- [dotenvx set KEY value -f | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/set-key-value-f)
  Set an (encrypted) key/value for another .env file.

- [dotenvx set KEY value | Dotenv](https://dotenvx.com/docs/advanced/set-key-value)
  Set a single key/value.
